com.ibm.team.repository.common

Class FileLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.team.repository.common.FileLocator

  • public final class FileLocator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains helper methods aimed at finding files in bundles. This class can be used regardless if OSGi plugin is available and will work in plain java clients.

    The class is not intended to be subclassed or instantiated by clients.

    For argument substitution to work under plain java clients, the following system variables must be set: osgi.nl, osgi.os, osgi.ws, osgi.arch.

    Since:
    0.5
    See Also:
    for more documentation on argument substitution.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public static java.net.URL find(java.lang.String bundleSymbolicName,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath path)
        Returns a URL for the given path in the given bundle. Returns null if the URL could not be computed or created.

        find looks for this path in given bundle and any attached fragments. null is returned if no such entry is found. Note that there is no specific order to the fragments.

        Parameters:
        bundleSymbolicName - the bundle's symbolic name in which to search; must not be null
        path - file path relative to plug-in installation location
        Returns:
        a URL for the given path or null. The actual form of the returned URL is not specified.

      • find

        public static java.net.URL find(java.lang.String bundleSymbolicName,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath path,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> override)
        Returns a URL for the given path in the given bundle. Returns null if the URL could not be computed or created.

        find looks for this path in given bundle and any attached fragments. null is returned if no such entry is found. Note that there is no specific order to the fragments.

        Parameters:
        bundleSymbolicName - the bundle's symbolic name in which to search; must not be null
        path - file path relative to plug-in installation location
        override - map of override substitution arguments to be used for any $arg$ path elements. The map keys correspond to the substitution arguments (eg. "$nl$" or "$os$"). If the map is null, or does not contain the required substitution argument, the default is used.
        Returns:
        a URL for the given path or null. The actual form of the returned URL is not specified.

      • findAll

        public static java.net.URL[] findAll(java.lang.String bundleSymbolicName,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath path)
        Returns all URLs for the given path in the given bundle. Returns empty array if the URL could not be computed or created.

        find looks for this path in given bundle and any attached fragments. Empty array is returned if no such entry is found. Note that there is no specific order to the fragments.

        Parameters:
        bundleSymbolicName - the bundle's symbolic name in which to search; must not be null
        path - file path relative to plug-in installation location
        Returns:
        all matching URLs for the given path; never null. The actual form of the returned URLs is not specified.

      • findAll

        public static java.net.URL[] findAll(java.lang.String bundleSymbolicName,
                                     org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath path,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> override)
        Returns all URLs for the given path in the given bundle. Returns empty array if the URL could not be computed or created.

        find looks for this path in given bundle and any attached fragments. Empty array is returned if no such entry is found. Note that there is no specific order to the fragments.

        Parameters:
        bundleSymbolicName - the bundle's symbolic name in which to search; must not be null
        path - file path relative to plug-in installation location
        override - map of override substitution arguments to be used for any $arg$ path elements. The map keys correspond to the substitution arguments (eg. "$nl$" or "$os$"). If the map is null, or does not contain the required substitution argument, the default is used.
        Returns:
        all matching URLs for the given path; never null. The actual form of the returned URLs is not specified.
